intro: Corysanthes autumnalis, commonly known as the autumn corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom during the autumn season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, winged fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Corysanthes autumnalis is a perennial shrub that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
